definitions.definition: (of something soft or elastic) be made or be capable of being made longer or wider without tearing or breaking.
examples: my sweater stretched in the wash

definitions.definition: cause to do this.
last or cause to last longer than expected.
examples: her nap had stretched to two hours
synonyms: spin out "stretch your weekend into a vacation"

definitions.definition: make great demands on the capacity or resources of.
examples: the cost of the court case has stretched their finances to the limit
synonyms: sap "the court case stretched their finances"

definitions.definition: cause (someone) to make maximum use of their talents or abilities.
examples: it's too easyâ€”it doesn't stretch me

definitions.definition: adapt or extend the scope of (something) in a way that exceeds a reasonable or acceptable limit.
examples: to describe her as sweet would be stretching it a bit

definitions.definition: straighten or extend one's body or a part of one's body to its full length, typically so as to tighten one's muscles or in order to reach something.
synonyms: straighten (out) More"he stretched his arms"lie down
loll "she stretched out on the sofa"

definitions.definition: extend or spread over an area or period of time.
examples: the beach stretches for over four miles

definitions.definition: an act of stretching one's limbs or body.
examples: I got up and had a stretch
synonyms: proffer; literaryoutreach "she stretched out her hand to him"

definitions.definition: the fact or condition of a muscle being stretched.
examples: she could feel the stretch and pull of the muscles in her legs

definitions.definition: a phase of a pitcher's delivery, during which the arms are raised above and behind the head.
a shortened form of a pitcher's windup, typically used to prevent base runners from stealing or gaining a long lead.
the capacity of a material or garment to stretch or be stretched; elasticity.
a difficult or demanding task.
examples: it was a stretch for me sometimes to come up with the rent

definitions.definition: a continuous area or expanse of land or water.
a continuous period of time.
a period of time spent in prison.
examples: a four-year stretch for tax fraud

definitions.definition: a straight part of a racetrack, typically the homestretch.
examples: he made a promising start, but faded down the stretch

definitions.definition: the distance covered on one tack.
a stretch limo.
